cont.entity_a: Performs well with excellent battery life.
cont.entity_b: Compact, fast movement, long battery life.

cont.entity_a: Middle button is tight and hard to push. Comfortable with extra buttons.
cont.entity_b: Buttons are easy to push, scroll wheel is nice. Buttons are hard to click, wheel is stiff.

cont.entity_a: Pointer is more sensitive than previous versions. Sensor is jumpy, not suitable for tasks beyond web browsing.
cont.entity_b: Laser sensor works on multiple surfaces. Pointer tracks erratically.

Connection.comm: USB adapter connects mouse in seconds.

cont.entity_a: Instant connection with no software installation required. Signal range is weaker than expected.
cont.entity_b: Limited range but good for laptop use. Receiver range is short, less than 16 inches.

cont.entity_a: Compact and easy to use. Not too heavy, feels substantial. Design is comfortable for large hands. Large mouse, not suitable for small hands.
cont.entity_b: Designed to be ambidextrous but not comfortable for long use. Compact and portable, suitable for travel. Compact but too small for average hand.
Requires IntellPoint software for full features.

cont.entity_a: Battery life is almost a year with Duracell Ultra. Battery life is longer than Logitech wireless mouse.
Receiver is large, almost the size of the mouse. Wireless receiver is large and has poor range.

cont.entity_b: Magnifier button is hard to turn off.

cont.entity_a: Comfortable design with good battery life. Feels slightly unbalanced with battery installed.
cont.entity_b: Not ergonomic, hard to left-click. Shape is not ergonomic.

cont.entity_a: Precision is good, easy to navigate. Not responsive or accurate, requires a mouse pad.
Signal strength issues with low battery messages. Signal interruptions and low signal strength.
cont.entity_b: Short on features and range, not recommended for gaming.
Not suitable for gaming due to smooth middle button.
Issues with screensaver function on Windows XP Media Center.
